line_2: What can this be, but some bright ray from heaven,

line_1: Such wond'rous pow'rs as these must sure be given
line_2: For most important purposes by heav'n;

line_1: This then's the first great law by Nature giv'n,
line_2: Stamp'd on our souls, and ratify'd by Heav'n;

line_1: Aims at rewards by her indulgence giv'n,
line_2: And soars triumphant on her wings to heav'n.

line_1: Because he yet to her no Child had given.
line_2: As if neglected by the God of Heav'n,

line_1: But in this blessed Age, such Freedom's given,
line_2: That every Man explains the Will of Heaven;

line_1: Has dazzling wit or deep discernment given:
line_2: To few, alas! th' indulgent hand of Heaven

line_1: To whom such force is giv'n,
line_2: The noblest work of Heav'n.

line_1: With ceaseless prayers, the whole artillery given
line_2: To win the mercies of offended heaven,

line_1: Observe but here the easie Precepts given,
line_2: Then wait with chearful hope, till Heaven be known in Heaven.

line_1: Sighs, that so oft for worldly cares are given,
line_2: No listening seraph fondly bears to heaven,

line_1: Some pleasures here with sparing hand are giv'n,
line_2: That sons of earth should taste their promis'd heav'n:

line_1: Such fitting object to each talent giv'n,
line_2: Earth cannot fit what was design'd for heav'n.

line_1: How bless'd the Mortal to whom these are giv'n:

line_2: The choicest blessings under heav'n;
